result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Alonzo Wilkerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth Alonzo Wilkerson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth Alonzo Wilkerson was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places
Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

Huber.

Failure to do so within the specified time will result in the immediate issuance of a commitment to Jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
